meanings.definition: Situated or occurring beneath a node.
meanings.sent1: The subnodal area of the network was hidden from view.
meanings.sent2: The subnodal position was crucial for the data transfer.
meanings.sent3: The subnodal creatures lived peacefully underground.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like subnodal roots, supporting the main concept.
meanings.sent5: The subnodal layer was dark and mysterious, like a hidden world.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a point on a network that is not a node.
meanings.sent1: The subnodal connection was secure and reliable.
meanings.sent2: The subnodal information helped in optimizing the network.
meanings.sent3: The subnodal server worked efficiently behind the scenes.
meanings.sent4: Her role was like a subnodal link, connecting different departments.
meanings.sent5: The subnodal data flow was steady and constant, like a quiet stream.

meanings.definition: Below or inferior to a node.
meanings.sent1: The data traveled subnodal the main hub.
meanings.sent2: The signal strength was weaker subnodal the central point.
meanings.sent3: He felt lost subnodal the main node of the network.
meanings.sent5: The subnodal location was dimly lit and less crowded.
